author: Ben Gao
title: SPD handin questions
question:
When we submit our problem sets/Labs using the SPD handin button, and if we get a "handin successful" message, and an autograder email.
I have a few questtions to confirm my understanding:
first: is that it? just confirming, there are NO other steps to handing in assignments, right?
second: is there any way we can truly verify our submission has been successful, and view our submissions?
Third: the submission being graded will be the most recent submission, correct, right?
Fourth: for both labs and assignments, we can submit as many times as we want to check our work, the only caveat being a increasing cooldown period to receive detailed feedback as the term progresses, right?
thanks.
instructor_answer:
Well setup questions.  Here you go:
- No other steps.
- If it says handin successful it was submitted.
- You will get one grading report email per submission; your grade will be based on the last submission.
- Yes.
